thread.title: Yankees' Joe Girardi doesn't exactly give ringing endorsement of Rob Refsnyder
thread.title_full: Yankees' Joe Girardi doesn't exactly give ringing endorsement of Rob Refsnyder

author: Ryan Hatch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Yankees' Joe Girardi doesn't exactly give ringing endorsement of Rob Refsnyder
text:
Yankees' Joe Girardi doesn't exactly give ringing endorsement of Rob Refsnyder Gerado Parra, Rob Refsnyder New York Yankees second baseman Rob Refsnyder, left, tags out Gerardo Parra on a steal-attempt in the first inning of the second baseball game of a doubleheader in Baltimore, Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015. (AP Photo/Gail Burton) (GAIL BURTON) Comments 
NEW YORK â€” Who's the Yankees ' second baseman next year? 
It would figure to be a mix of Rob Refsnyder and Dustin Ackley, and maybe it will, but manager Joe Girardi didn't sound exactly enthusiastic about that idea on Friday in his postmortem press conference on the 2015 season. 
"I thought [Refsnyder] improved at Triple-A over the course of the season," Girardi said. "I think it's...you look at him, you look at what's available and you make a decision." 
Look at what's available? Maybe they'll bring back Robinson Cano? 
Refsnyder hit .302 with two home runs in his 16 games (plus no errors in 51 chances) with the big league squad and yes, as Girardi also said, it's a small sample size, but if you extrapolate that into a full season it equates to 20 home runs and an above-average defender. For context: only two big league second baseman hit 20 home runs in 2015. PLUS : Why didn't Brett Gardner steal in 2nd half? Joe Girardi doesn't know 
And Girardi didn't sound much more comfortable with the idea of Ackley playing second base full time either. 
"I think you look at [Ackley]," Girardi said. But I think that's something that will have to be addressed this winter."
